intro: Banisteria lucida, commonly known as the shining banisteria, is a tropical climbing plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Banisteria lucida is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
